title: [REQUEST] A way to pipe directly into a Console (without anything showing in the terminal instance)
body:
Have you checked the issues for a similar suggestions? Yes, unless I'm searching wrong, no one else has suggested this.

**How would you improve Rich?**

Being able to just pipe something like a `Table` in and getting plaintext output out would be nice to have.

**What problem does it solved for you?**

I am currently attempting to make this library work with my Discord bot. It works great for i.e. tracebacks in console, and can also work with Discord's codeblock formatting in a way using `export_text()`: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8301262/91700639-d5283000-eb3b-11ea-98ba-0f3a4465a828.png)

... There is just *one* tiny problem.

Whenever I run the `^^config list` command, it seems to log to console too:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8301262/91700832-0f91cd00-eb3c-11ea-8d1b-4b10a1d0b8fe.png)

This might not be bad for a small developer instance like mine where I'm just testing stuff, but it doesn't really work out in production, as I don't want to see a lot of command outputs in my logs.

This problem can very easily be tracked down to the function where I "construct" the table:

```py
    async def construct_table(self, parts):
        table = Table(show_header=True)
        table.add_column("Property")
        table.add_column("Value")
        async for part in parts:
            table.add_row(part["property"], part["value"])
        self.rich_console.print(table) # Required to "record" the output so we can export it to text
        return self.rich_console.export_text()
```

Personally not sure how to best tackle this issue; maybe a `Console.record()`?

Love this lib, thanks for all that you do!
